summary: This bill, the 'Defending Domestic Orange Juice Production Act of 2025,' introduced in the Senate, aims to modify the federal standards for pasteurized orange juice. It specifically seeks to increase the minimum required percentage of orange juice soluble solids in finished pasteurized orange juice to 10.0%, excluding sweetening ingredients. The bill also clarifies that the Secretary of Health and Human Services retains the authority to amend these standards via regulation.
